publicwhip.spmotion: *S1M-277 Dennis Canavan: Chechnya—That the Parliament notes representations made by the Secretary of State for Foreign and Commonwealth Affairs to the Russian Foreign Minister about the situation in Chechnya; expresses deep concern over the Russian military offensive which continues to have devastating effects upon civilian life and property; salutes the work of agencies working in this area to promote respect for humanitarian principles, and calls upon the international community to take action to alleviate the plight of refugees and to ensure respect for democracy and human rights in Chechnya.

S1M-277 Dennis Canavan: Chechnya-That the Parliament notes representations made by the Secretary of State for Foreign and Commonwealth Affairs to the Russian Foreign Minister about the situation in Chechnya; expresses deep concern over the Russian military offensive which continues to exact devastating effects upon civilian life and property; salutes the work of agencies working in this area to promote respect for humanitarian principles, and calls upon the international community to take action to alleviate the plight of refugees and to ensure respect for democracy and human rights in Chechnya. Supported by: Alex Neil*, Tommy Sheridan*
S1M-277 Chechnya (lodged on 11 November 1999) Linda Fabiani*
S1M-277 Chechnya (lodged on 11 November 1999) Mrs Margaret Ewing*, Dr Winnie Ewing*, Mr John McAllion*
S1M-277 Chechnya (lodged on 11 November 1999) Ben Wallace*, Michael Matheson*, Brian Adam*, Andrew Wilson*
S1M-277 Chechnya (lodged on 11 November 1999) Ms Sandra White*

S1M-277 Dennis Canavan: Chechnya—That the Parliament notes representations made by the Secretary of State for Foreign and Commonwealth Affairs to the Russian Foreign Minister about the situation in Chechnya; expresses deep concern over the Russian military offensive which continues to exact devastating effects upon civilian life and property; salutes the work of agencies working in this area to promote respect for humanitarian principles, and calls upon the international community to take action to alleviate the plight of refugees and to ensure respect for democracy and human rights in Chechnya. Supported by: Alex Neil, Tommy Sheridan, Linda Fabiani, Mrs Margaret Ewing, Dr Winnie Ewing, Mr John McAllion, Ben Wallace, Michael Matheson, Brian Adam, Andrew Wilson, Ms Sandra White, Tricia Marwick*, Mr Adam Ingram*
